reviews.text: Best ramen place in nyc for me. We come here regularly. Spicy edamame is fire and so is the spicy tonkotsu!!
The food was excellent

Meijen Ramen is such a great spot. It‚Äôs my first time coming here and I‚Äôll definitely be a repeat customer. The vibes‚Ä¶ amazing, the food‚Ä¶ delectable, and the service‚Ä¶ incredible. From the moment we arrived, they made us feel right at home. I ordered the tonkotsu ramen and the pork broth was absolutely amazing. High recommend stopping by!
Delishious
Really loved the pumpkin tempura and edo sushi roll as an appetizer to my beef ramen. I love that this spot has broths other than pork for some variety
I love this spot! Amazing food, nice staff, good vibes. My favorite neighborhood restaurant
My new fav ramen spot now. Came here on Halloween night and the food gave me goosebumps in a good way LOL

I‚Äôve been to plenty of ramen spots from New Jersey to New York. I‚Äôll admit, this was by far one of the greatest places that I‚Äôve ever been to. This will be my favorite place to go!!!! Not only was the food fantastic, but so were the drinks!!!! This place is definitely worth looking into!
The short rib ramen is INSANE! Please try it while you can!!
Love this place,  my husband & I been coming here for few years now, any dish we get never disappoints! We love this place ‚ô•Ô∏è
Loved my spicy tuna.
I love this place !
Great time as always, can never go wrong with any item on the food.
wait time was around 10 min, food and atmosphere are amazing :) salmon poke was very hearty! great service and drinks.
very good food and good atmosphere.
Great service! Great eats. Loved the atmosphere
Every time I order delivery they forget items and take over an hour. Soup is barely warm. Today they forgot 2 orders of gyoza for my kids. Truly terrible attention to detail or caring about service.
Took double the order time, and they forgot some of the food we paid for.
Crazy good Ramen. Fast even tho it was busy, and omg THE SUSHI!
I‚Äôve come here multiple times and have had the best service! 10/10
So FRESH... best ramen I have literally ever had. That plus the tea and the water??? Call me crazy but i'm in love
Food is very yummy and the water service was immaculate. Have never experienced such rigor in serving.
Pretty fire spicy miso
Good soups

First time coming to this spot! I‚Äôm a huge ramen lover, did not have big expectations but wow, the service, kindness, and food variety were 5 stars level! The manager, and the rest of the staff were very attentive. Definitely will be coming back now that winter is on its way!
Been here twice already! Food is amazing my favourites are the arugula salad, squid legs and the shredded pork ramen!!
This is their 10th year anniversary! Such a yummy spot nestled on the East side. Great portion size and flavor!
Love this place!
Hidden gem in east village serving creamy and delicious bowl of ramen. Would highly recommend the spicy pork tonkontsu ramen .
Amazing bowl of ramen, really recommend the Shio style, tasted like Tokyo!
niceÔºÅ
Delicious!!!
really yummy ramen , sat at the bar . cute place with great service . food came out fast and was a very reasonable price ! cocktail was great too .
Nice little ramen shop and bar in UES! I asked for the Okinawa ramen to be less salty and they were able to accommodate the request, great service!
I love it here ‚ô•Ô∏èü•π
Nice restautant
Es un lugar con muy buena comida, ambiente y m√∫sica, lo recomiendo. Como apetaizer tuve Takoyaki 10/10, y el shio ramen muy bue sabor!!!
Great ramen, really cool atmosphere inside
Walked in on a Saturday night and was seated within 10 mins! Great food, portions and drinks were strong! Highly recommend.
Fire

Looking for a great informal Japanese restaurant in NYC? Meijin fits the bill! Pumpkin tempura and sweet chili shrimp for starters, with Mei-Jin and Veggie Ramen for mains. Great service and fun atmosphere!
Comida muy buena
Everything was delicious! Would come again. Get the tuna on crispy riceü§û
Ë∂ÖÂ•ΩÂêÉÔºÅÂÄºÂæóÂÜç‰æÜÔºÅ

Always delicious food, excellent service, in a welcoming atmosphere
Can't go wrong with any of their ramen!

Meijin is awesome! The ramen is rich, flavorful, and super comforting ‚Äî you can tell the broth is made with care. The noodles are perfectly chewy, and the toppings are always fresh. The place has a nice, cozy vibe and the staff are really friendly. Great spot for a quick, satisfying meal any day of the week! üçúüî•

I am shocked to see such positive reviews. This is one of the worst ramen I've had in NYC. Broth was not properly seasoned and it was lukewarm. The noodles were overcooked to the point of feeling mushy.

If you enjoy good ramen, please take this review seriously.
The food and ambience was great couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience

Me and my daughter came on a Friday night. The wait was about ten minutes. We were entertained by the paper cranes hanging from the ceiling. The food tasted wonderful! We ordered the seared scallops, soft crab buns & their chicken chasu ramen. The seared scallops were cooked to perfection and the soft crabs were crunchy and seasoned just right. The broth for the ramen was creamy and delicious, and the noodles were cooked well. As for dessert, we had Vanilla crepe cake - it was divine! Excellent finish to our dinner.

I had lunch with my boyfriend ‚Äî delicious ramen and amazing food. Thanks to Abby for his service and especially for his honesty; by mistake I left a very large tip and he let me know. We need more honest people like him!

I love the place, the vibe, the service, and the food.
Highly recommended!

After a wonderful walk through the Guggenheim Museum, my friends and I were craving something hearty. Summer in New York felt as if it had suddenly been switched off ‚Äî the weather outside was cool and autumn-like. That combination of hunger and chill led us straight to Meijin Ramen.

The menu is impressively well thought out ‚Äî we wanted to try almost everything. We started with the bao buns: pork for some of us, crab for others. The buns themselves could have been fluffier, but the fillings were flavorful. A solid four out of five.

For ramen, we tried a few varieties. The beef ramen was hearty, with rich broth, firm noodles, and good-quality meat. The pork ramen turned out to be one of the best we‚Äôve had ‚Äî our friends especially loved it. The chicken ramen also didn‚Äôt disappoint. We added a salmon poke bowl, with fresh pieces of salmon and a spicy mayo ‚Äî delicious, and it came with miso soup on the side.

To finish, we ordered the matcha tiramisu. It was unusual, dense, and made with high-quality matcha ‚Äî a creative and satisfying dessert.

Overall, we left full and happy. The prices are fair for the quality, and Meijin Ramen is definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre in the neighborhood.

Loved the food here! üç£ The spicy salmon poke was fresh, flavorful, and topped with just the right amount of creamy sauce and tobiko. The seaweed salad and avocado on the side made it even better. The fried squid was perfectly crispy on the outside and tender inside, paired with a tasty spicy mayo and fresh lemon. Definitely a spot I‚Äôd come back!

Their weekday Bento sets are honestly one of the best deals you will find in the UES . Starting at $14 you are getting a little taste of Japan right in the middle of your workday.  Each set comes with a soba salad, warm miso soup and a perfectly shaped onigiri that‚Äôs simple yet so satisfying. Available Monday to Friday , 12-3 PM, dine-in only.

But what makes Meijin really shines are their ramen. Specifically, their signature Washu Beef ramen which have been served over a decade. The Washu beef is incredible tender  and so flavorful in every bite.

Love the location, the food is amazing! I was t sure how the banana sushi would taste but it was really good. Also the takoyaki is delicious! Definitely a cute chill spot for good sushi. The aburi seared roll is great also, the combination of the shrimp tempura with avocado and salmon melted on the tongue! The vibe of the restaurant is chill.

I love this place. Nice and cozy. The appetizer was great. The honemade gyoza was juicy and the Hokkaido scallop was delicious. Our main was Washu beef masamen omg was super yummy. Service was great. Overall was amazing.

Meijin is my go to place , when I want ramen I always come here but I just found out that Meijin is more than ramen, they have appetizers , tapas, curry, sushi. Today I got to try Hokkaido Scallops, Gyoza, and Bale crab roll. They are all delicious. Definitely recommend

I had the Summer Seafood Ceviche Cold Noodle and String Bean Tempura at Meijin Ramen NYC, and I absolutely loved it! The flavors were fresh and vibrant‚Äîperfect for a hot day. The seafood was refreshing, and the tempura was crispy and light. Definitely coming back for more!
They have pretty solid food. The crispy salmon, scallop and wagyu on their summer menu taste delicious. The highball tastes too light.
Abby was amazing!! Abby recommended me the best cocktails and took such great care of me. Love the vibez and friendliness. I would definitely love to come back with more friends.

Intimate setting, authentic tonkatsu ramen.

Really darkly lit bathroom with a unique view of a display seen from both bathrooms which was slightly unusual.

We stopped by for an early dinner - it was empty when we walked in but by peak dinner time, it was packed.

We ordered agedashi tofu, crispy rice with spicy tuna, takoyaki and spicy chicken ramen. We didn't love the agedashi tofu (there are other local restaurants we prefer for this menu), crispy rice was good but I personally wished it was a bit smaller as it was hard to take a bite, takoyaki was great, and the ramen was good too. It had been a while since we had a chicken ramen (we always go for pork, tonkotsu) so it was a change.
Next time, I'd like to try their pork based ramen. They also have a bar setting next door - I would love to try next time as well

Excellent place in Upper East Side!

Amazing food, great atmosphere I would I suggest.

Delicious food and a wonderful experience at Meijin. The dishes were full of flavor and beautifully served. Special thanks to Nadia for her excellent service ‚Äî so friendly and attentive. Highly recommend this place!

The draft beers are clean, the ramen has authentic noodles, and you can tell the broth has been simmered for a couple of hours! The appetizers including the shishito peppers, the fried chicken, and the gyoza are also always delicious. :)

We went during dinner time so it was packed. There was even a line for table waiting to be available. We opted for bar seating so we were able to seat faster.

Not my best choice for Ramen but definitely a place to consider and try! Servers were attentive and accommodating too! Food, excellent!

Takoyaki as always and fried chicken. All Ramen, a must try!

We were a table of 4 and arrived for dinner at 5 and service was very fast. The servers checked up on us often, refilling waters and asking how the food was. The food was great and portions were sizable! Overall wonderful experience.

This place has its positives, such as delicious food and a convenient location, but there were a few issues that left a less-than-pleasant impression. Firstly, there was no light in the restroom, which was quite uncomfortable. Secondly, it took over 10 minutes for the waitstaff to come and take our order, which is unacceptable for a restaurant with such a rating. Additionally, their appearance was not up to standard, which didn't add to the cozy atmosphere of the place. Considering these points, I‚Äôm giving it 4 stars instead of 5. I hope the management takes note of these shortcomings and improves the service.
Amazing service! Our waiter was so sweet and so attentive, and the plate design was perfect for photos too! Kept refilling our waters and checking in on us to make sure all was well!

The Okinawa special ramen was DECADENT. Amazing flavor, hearty, creamy. The cha siu pork was tender. The service was top tier. The atmosphere was so comfortable and homey. Would recommend if you're in the area!

The atmosphere is awesome. We just visited this for first time. The stir fried noodle  with clam shell is fantastic one and only in nyc.   The second best is pumpkin tempura is a great appetizer that u could not missed it here.

The staffs also nice and absolute friendly
We hope to visit there as soon as possible.
Really nice place! I got the spicy miso ramen and it was really good and the hand rolls!! AMAZING. Really nice atmosphere and calm vibes 10/10 üíï

We got the spicy tuna roll and Okinawa ramen to share- both were very very good. The ramen broth was full of flavor, the pork was very seasoned and overall the food was spot on. The best part aside from the food, was the service. They were very attentive, very polite and kind and definitely made sure our water glasses were topped! Would highly recommend if you‚Äôre in the area!!!!
Absolutely delicious meal! Perfect date night after going to the met on a Friday. Can‚Äôt wait to go back <3

Dropped by after the MET and you know we came in hungry! Don‚Äôt worry because their food and service is just immaculate. The wagyu ramen was the perfect portion and food looked just like the pictures! We also ordered three appetizers to share and they all served üíÅüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

This is a chill ramen shop with good food, what else do you need? So make sure you come check it out!
This place is so cute, and the service is excellent. I had the pork bun and chicken broth ramen‚Äîperfect for a cold, cloudy day when you need a little pick-me-up.

The place is nice, and so is the food. We ordered the Chicken Karaage and Beef Miso, and they tasted great, perfectly balanced, not too salty, so you‚Äôd still want to mix them with your curry. Overall, the vibe is great, and the servers were really friendly. Kudos!
Came here to celebrate my kids winning of a competition. Excellent food! Definitely One of the most authentic Japanese food around. With affordable price and family friendly atmosphere. Love it!

Has a wonderful time with friends.  Even though a bit small, it was very inviting and cozy.  They were able to accommodate a group of 6 comfortably.  Oh and Todd were excellent and very attentive.  Gave recommendations, which was spot on and were very understanding with dietary needs.  They suggested dessert which were excellent and will HIGH recommend!!  It was Green tea matcha Crepe and a Vanilla Crepe, both hit the spot and it made the ending but s cherry in top. üçí

I ordered food for pick up. What I got are Hiyashi cold noodle and Spicy wings. I was  in the mood for cold ramen now , thank goodness they still had this item. It was so good as usual. Spicy wings was tasty and flavorful, not too spicy a little bit sweet. The service was great and quick. Definitely come back for more

The ramen is not very salty, I personally very into this flavoring.
Origami cranes at the roof are very cute

This has been my go-to ramen spot on the Upper East Side over the past couple of years. Big fan of the seasonal Menus and especially the Okinawa Ramen. Food is always fresh and consistent. It would be a tough task to find a better bowl of noodles with a great vibe in the neighborhood.
Trendy and upscale ramen spot, I was surprise there was a lot to choose from. I got the seared scallop appetizer and the washu ramen. Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

This was the most delicious ramen I have ever had and I want to gatekeep so bad LOL! This was the first time I've ever heard of Meijin.

First, the service and ambiance were top tier. Very chic and trendy perfect for a girls night, romantic date, or even a solo date (which is my favorite way to enjoy ramen). I ordered the soft shell crab over salad and I've only ever had soft shell crab once prior to this; I wish this was my first experience because it was so good! I literally cleaned the plate!

I also ordered a delicious, savory bowl of Spicy Miso Ramen which was by far the best ramen I have had thus far; even beating my usual spot. I completely drank the broth and the portion was pretty big. You definitely get quality ingredients for the price and you'll feel amazing after.

Of course it wouldn't be dinner without cocktails; so I ordered two Haku Highball's and they were clean and refreshing to keep me balanced throughout the meal without compromising flavor. Definitely a palette cleanse and smooth buzz!

Definitely Bringing my friends here with me next time!

With temperatures in the 30s, it‚Äôs officially ramen season, and this turned out to be a great neighborhood spot for some different ramen options. I went with the beef, which you don‚Äôt see at many places, and it was so good‚Äî excellent heartwarming broth, some nice crunch from wood ear mushrooms, and tender slices of beef. I did wish my noodles had been a tad firmer, but apart from that, excellent!
Great food and service!  Super yummy.  I hope the owner's husband stops smoking and works towards a healthy heart.
Very good food! They came over constantly checking in on me and filling up my drink. Gave great details on the menu when I had questions.

My boyfriend and I came across this restaurant and were very pleased with their food and customer service. I highly recommend their chicken bowl. It was delicious! For my first trip to NY, Im super happy I ate here!

‚ÄúPhenomenal Service // Best Ramen EVER !‚Äù
Our server, Sherry was very attentive! All of her suggestions were very delicious. Don‚Äôt afraid to ask your server for recommendations because they know it the best. The food came out pretty fast and steaming hot. The appetizers were the best part of this visit. The crispy rice tuna was my favorite, highly recommended. I had Tonkutsu ramen which is so rich and well-balanced flavor. The broth was fragrant and went so well with the toppings...I love it a lot. I‚Äôll definitely be back when I visit New York next time.
